nameOfProject: Multisectoral humenitarian assistance including CP and FSL
objective: The most vulnerable girls and boys, particularly survivors of SGBV, and children who continue to suffer from the legacies of conflict such as those living with conflict-related disability, CAAFAG, children  with presumed affiliations and their caregivers have access to inclusive and gender-sensitive life-saving, child protection and psychosocial support assistance at the individual and community level and young people and caregivers affected by conflict are able to meet their basic needs and reintegrate back into their communities.
activity: Structured Psychosocial support programs.

nameOfProject: Multisectoral humenitarian assistance including CP and FSL
objective: The most vulnerable girls and boys, particularly survivors of SGBV, and children who continue to suffer from the legacies of conflict such as those living with conflict-related disability, CAAFAG, children  with presumed affiliations and their caregivers have access to inclusive and gender-sensitive life-saving, child protection and psychosocial support assistance at the individual and community level and young people and caregivers affected by conflict are able to meet their basic needs and reintegrate back into their communities.
activity: Case Management service.

nameOfProject: Multisectoral humenitarian assistance including CP and FSL
objective: The most vulnerable girls and boys, particularly survivors of SGBV, and children who continue to suffer from the legacies of conflict such as those living with conflict-related disability, CAAFAG, children  with presumed affiliations and their caregivers have access to inclusive and gender-sensitive life-saving, child protection and psychosocial support assistance at the individual and community level and young people and caregivers affected by conflict are able to meet their basic needs and reintegrate back into their communities.
